verses.kjv: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples unto him, and saith unto them,
verses.ct: During that time, a huge crowd had gathered and they had nothing to eat. Jesus called his disciples over and told them,

verses.kjv: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:
verses.ct: "My heart goes out to these people. They've been with me for 3 days now and have nothing to eat.

verses.kjv: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.
verses.ct: If I send them home hungry, they'll collapse on the road, because some of them traveled a long distance to get here."

verses.kjv: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness?
verses.ct: His disciples replied, "Where could anyone possibly find enough food to feed all these people out here in this remote place?"

verses.kjv: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.
verses.ct: He asked them, "How many loaves of bread do you have?" They answered, "7."

verses.kjv: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before them; and they did set them before the people.
verses.ct: He directed the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the 7 loaves, gave thanks to God, broke them apart, and handed the pieces to his disciples to distribute. They passed them out to the crowd.

verses.kjv: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before them.
verses.ct: They also had a few small fish. He blessed these and told the disciples to distribute them as well.

verses.kjv: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets.
verses.ct: Everyone ate until they were full, and afterward they collected 7 baskets of leftover pieces.

verses.kjv: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.
verses.ct: Around 4,000 people had eaten. Then Jesus sent the crowd on their way.

verses.kjv: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.
verses.ct: Right away he got into a boat with his disciples and traveled to the region of Dalmanutha.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.
verses.ct: The Pharisees showed up and started arguing with him, demanding a miraculous sign from heaven to test him.

verses.kjv: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.
verses.ct: Jesus let out a deep sigh and said, "Why does this generation keep demanding a sign? Truly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation."

verses.kjv: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.
verses.ct: Then he left them, got back in the boat, and crossed to the other side of the lake.

verses.kjv: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.
verses.ct: The disciples had forgotten to bring food along, and they only had a single loaf of bread with them in the boat.

verses.kjv: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.
verses.ct: Jesus warned them, "Watch out — guard yourselves against the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod."

verses.kjv: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have no bread.
verses.ct: They discussed this among themselves and concluded, "He's saying this because we didn't bring any bread."

verses.kjv: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
verses.ct: Jesus realized what they were thinking and said to them, "Why are you talking about not having bread? Don't you get it yet? Don't you understand? Are your hearts still so stubborn?

verses.kjv: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?
verses.ct: You have eyes — can't you see? You have ears — can't you hear? Don't you remember anything?

verses.kjv: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.
verses.ct: When I broke the 5 loaves for the 5,000, how many baskets full of leftovers did you pick up?" They answered, "12."

verses.kjv: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.
verses.ct: "And when I broke the 7 loaves for the 4,000, how many baskets full of leftovers did you pick up?" They answered, "7."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
verses.ct: He said to them, "How can you still not understand?"

verses.kjv: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.
verses.ct: They arrived at Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man to Jesus, begging him to touch the man.

verses.kjv: And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.
verses.ct: Jesus took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. He spit on the man's eyes and placed his hands on him, then asked, "Can you see anything?"

verses.kjv: And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.
verses.ct: The man looked around and said, "I can see people, but they look like trees moving around."

verses.kjv: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.
verses.ct: Jesus placed his hands on the man's eyes again and told him to look. This time his sight was completely restored, and he could see everything clearly.

verses.kjv: And he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell it to any in the town.
verses.ct: Jesus sent him home with the instruction, "Don't go into the village, and don't tell anyone in the village about this."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Caesarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?
verses.ct: Jesus and his disciples headed out toward the villages around Caesarea Philippi. Along the road, he asked his disciples, "Who do people say that I am?"

verses.kjv: And they answered, John the Baptist: but some say, Elias; and others, One of the prophets.
verses.ct: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist. Others say Elias. And others say you're one of the prophets."

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am? And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.
verses.ct: He pressed them, "But who do you say I am?" Peter spoke up and said, "You are the Christ."

verses.kjv: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.
verses.ct: Jesus strictly ordered them not to tell anyone about this.

verses.kjv: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and of the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
verses.ct: Then he began teaching them that the Son of man would have to endure terrible suffering, be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, be killed, and then rise again after 3 days.

verses.kjv: And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.
verses.ct: He spoke about this plainly and directly. Peter pulled him aside and started to correct him.

verses.kjv: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.
verses.ct: But Jesus turned around, looked at his disciples, and rebuked Peter sharply: "Get away from me, Satan! You're not thinking about things from God's perspective — you're thinking from a purely human perspective."

verses.kjv: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also, he said unto them, Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.ct: Then he called the crowd over along with his disciples and told them, "Whoever wants to follow me must deny themselves, pick up their cross, and come after me.

verses.kjv: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel’s, the same shall save it.
verses.ct: Because whoever tries to hold on to their life will lose it, but whoever gives up their life for my sake and for the gospel will actually save it.

verses.kjv: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
verses.ct: What good is it for someone to gain the entire world but lose their own soul?

verses.kjv: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.ct: What could anyone possibly offer in exchange for their soul?

verses.kjv: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
verses.ct: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this unfaithful and sinful generation, the Son of man will also be ashamed of that person when he arrives in the glory of his Father with the holy angels."
